progress

0%



challenges

comments
hintDid someone leave a flag in the comments and forget to remove it?
solutionVisit the login page (you will need to logout to do so).There, right click and select 'view page source'. Within the code there is a HTML comment containing a flag.
flagflag{ch4cK c0MmenT5}

hidden product
hintCan you work out the URL to find a secret product not displayed on the home page?
solutionVisit the page of any animal displayed on the home page. From there change the number in the URL to 1. your URL should now end in '1.html'. Once you visit this URL, a flag is displayed onscreen.
flagflag{d0n't U5e IncR3mEntAL URLs}

robots
hintA file containing instructions for web crawlers. (Google may help)
solutionEdit your current URL by removing '/progress' and replacing it with '/robots.txt'. If you visit this new URL, there is a flag displayed in the text.
flagflag{4lwAy5_ch3cK_R0boTs}

admin page
hint 1Solving the previous challenge may help you
hint 2What are the default credentials? (Google may help)
solutionEdit your current URL by removing '/progress' and replacing it with '/phpmyadmin.html'. If you visit this new URL, you will find an admin login page. If you login with the default credentials (username = 'root', password = ''), a flag is displayed.
flagflag{d0nT us3 DeF4uLt Cr3d5}

SQL login - log in to the admin's account. Her email is 'admin@guest.com'
hintTry a very simple SQL injection on the main login page. (Google may help)
solutionVisit the login page. Try to login with the email 'admin@guest.com;--' and any password. A flag will be displayed on screen.
flagflag{d1s5aLloW sp3Ci4l cHar4cteR5}

XSS - retrieve the element with the id 'flag'
hint 1Is there a page on this website where text a user enters gets displayed on screen?
hint 2Use the 'img' tag. (Google may help)
solutionVisit the page for any animal. In the review box, leave the following review:
<img src = "" onerror = 'alert(document.getElementById("flag").innerHTML)'>
flagflag{ch4cK u53R 1nPut5}
